Configuring ETL process gateways
In case of parallelization of ETL schemas, gateways are used.
The custom items control the order in which the ETL data is loaded.
On the ETL schema
, the gateway is represented as follows (by default, the System will display an Exclusive gateway, which is described below):
To change the gateway type, use the
icon.
The following types of gateways are processed on the ETL schema:
– an exclusive gateway. A gateway of this type is activated when at least one data flow appears. When there are multiple outgoing data flows, the scheme execution continues on only one of them. To do this, the gateway checks all flows in the loop and selects the first one for which one of the conditions is met:
There is no sign of the conditional transition
There is a sign of conditional transition, but there is no algorithm for the condition
The conditional transition algorithm returned true
If no condition is met for any of the outgoing flows, the execution will continue with the default transition.
– an inclusive (non-exclusive) gateway. The item triggers each time a data flow is received. This gateway can initiate from one to more outgoing data flows. The list of triggered outgoing data flows is defined synchronously (similar to the exclusive gateway algorithm). If there are more than one flows in the settings, all triggered flows are started according to their number. If 1 (one) is specified, all triggered data flows will start one by one synchronously.
– a parallel gateway. This gateway is triggered only when all incoming flows are executed. Next, the processing of the item and the initiation of outgoing flows is performed the same way as with the inclusive gateway.
The number of incoming flows for the inclusive (non-exclusive) and parallel gateways is indicated when configured by the
icon.
